comments.body: Any reason this couldn't be `noarch: python`?

I'm not %100 sure, the `setup.py` for the package suggests that the generated unicode tables are python-version-specific:

https://github.com/facelessuser/backrefs/blob/master/setup.py#L34-L45

but I haven't done a through audit to determine if this is true or if the generated tables are platform specific.

Is there a mechanism in place to build a `noarch: python`, but test against multiple python versions?
Not really. Looking it over, it doesn't look trivial to adapt it to non-version-specific functionality. I guess it can just stay as-is then.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +13,17 @@build:
  number: 0
  skip: true  # [py<=34]
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv
